All adults from 18 years and above, is recommended to be physically active in total at least 150 minutes per week. The intensity should be at least moderate. At high intensity it is recommended at least 75 minutes per week. Activity at high and moderate intensity can be combined. The activity should be spread over several of the weeks days, and each sessions should be at least 10 minutes. 

Examples of physical activity that meet the recommendations is 30 minutes of brisk walking 5 days per week, 20 – 30 minutes running 3 days per week or a combination of these.

(Source: Swedish medical society 2011)
Only measure activity with high intensity

A simple explanation: The swedish medical society recommends moderate activity of at least 150 minutes per week. This app automatically counts each minute of physical activity with high intensity as two minutes of moderate intensity. 

"Recommended time left today" shows how many minutes of activity you should have to fulfill the recommendations of the swedish medical society, the last 7 days.

The teal part of the piechart represents your activity on "vigorous intensity", and the green slice shows your activity on "moderate intensity".
